questiontext.text: A 4-year-old girl was accompanied by her mother came to the General Hospital with a complaint of spacing anterior teeth. Extraoral examination presented normal profile. Intaoral examination showed complete dentition, gaps in anterior teeth RA and RB. The general health of the child is good, with adequate nutrition and a normal diet. This condition is normal for a child her age. What is the correct term in this case?

A 13-year-old boy was accompanied by his mother come to the General Hospital with a complaint of her upper jaw was more prominent than the lower jaw. Extraoral examination presented convex profile, symmetrical face. Intraoral examination showed large overjet, normal inclination of upper and lower anterior teeth , teeth 18, 28, 38, 48 have not erupted, first molar relation is distocclusion. Cephalometric analysis of SNA 87 and SNB 80 . What is the direction of the growth disturbance in the above case?

A 14-year-old girl came with his mother to the General Hospital with a complaint that the lower jaw was more prominent than the upper jaw. Extraoral examination presented concave profile, symmetrical face. Intraoral examination showed overjet -4 mm, normal inclination of upper and lower anterior teeth , teeth 18, 28, 38, 48 have not erupted, first molar relation is mesioocclusion. Cephalometric analysis of SNA 80 and SNB 84. What is the growth center of the abnormal jaw in the scenario above??

A 25-year-old male patient came to General dental Hospital with complaints of difficulty opening his mouth. The results of the anamnesis revealed that there was discomfort and soreness on the right side of his jaw since 5 days ago. According to doctors, this is caused by inflammation of the cheek muscles. What is the name of the muscle referred to in this scenario?

A 4 year old girl was accompanied by her mother came to the RSGM for a dental check-up. Extraoral examination presented normal profile. Intaoral examination showed complete dentition, space in upper and lower anterior teeth. The general health of the child is good, with adequate nutrition and a normal diet. What is the normal condition in the above case?

A 15 year old girl came with her mother to the RSGM for a dental check-up. Extraoral examination presented a straight profile and symmetrical face. Intraoral examination showed all teeth were erupted except third molars. There was no caries and molar relations is normal. What is the normal condition in this case?

A 10-year-old girl came with her mother to the General Hospital with a complaint of a spacing in the upper tooth. Extraoral examination straight profile, symmetrical face. Intraoral examination, there was a diastema on teeth 11 and 21, teeth 12, 11, 21, 22 tilted distally. The dentist told him that this condition was normal for a girl in her age. What is the term used for the conditions in the scenario?

An 11-year-old boy was accompanied by his mother came to the General Hospital with complaints of not being able to bite in the posterior teeth. Extraoral examination presented normal profile. Intraoral examination showed lesions on the tongue margin and macroglossia as well as open bite of the molars. What is the possible etiology in this case?

A 12-year-old girl was acompanied by her mother to visit the Orthodontic Clinic of RSGM Unhas with a complaint of spacing in the front teeth of the upper jaw. Extraoral examination presented normal profile. Intraoral examination showed the central diastema, high labial frenulum and interdental papillae between 11 and 21 extended to the palate. What is the etiology in the above case?

A 17-year-old boy visited the RSGM with a complaint of spacing and tilted in the front upper teeth. Extraoral examination showed normal profile. Intra-oral examination showed fully erupted teeth except for tooth 23. The results of the panoramic photo examination of the impacted of tooth 23. What types of additional tests were performed to confirm the diagnosis of the above case?

A 10-year-old boy was accompanied by his mother to the General Hospital with complaints of prominent teeth. Extraoral examination presented convex profile and symmetrical face. Intraoral examination there are overjet 5 mm, overbite 0 mm and multiple diastema anterior teeth RA. Cephalometric analysis of anterior teeth inclination RA 135o . The patient will be treated with a removable orthodontic appliance. What is the type of movement of the RA anterior teeth in the above case?

An 8-year-old boy was accompanied by his mother came to the General Hospital with complaints of advanced teeth. Extraoral examination convex profile with callus on thumb. Intraoral examination of the deep palate, protrusion of the upper anterior teeth, cusp to cusp occlusion in the right and left posterior regions and mild gingivitis. Children with bad habits. What is the possible etiology of the above case?

An 8-year-old girl came with her mother to the RSGMP with a complaint of her lower front teeth were more prominent than the upper teeth. Extraoral examination presented symmetrical facial and concave profile. Intraoral examination showed negative overjet and deep overbite, crossbite of teeth 12,11,21,22 with mild diastema of teeth 11, 21. Molar relation is neutrocclusion. What is the intraoral examination in the scenario above?

An 8-year-old girl came with her mother to the RSGMP with a complaint of her lower front teeth were more prominent than the upper teeth. Extraoral examination presented symmetrical facial and concave profile. Intraoral examination showed negative overjet and deep overbite, crossbite of teeth 12,11,21,22 with mild diastema of teeth 11, 21. Molar relation is neutrocclusion. What is the biggest impact from the above case?

An 8-year-old girl came with her mother to the RSGMP with a complaint that her upper front teeth were growing upside down. Extraoral examination presented concave profile and symmetrical face. Intraoral examination showed negative overjet and deep overbite, crossbite of teeth 12,11,21,22 with mild diastema of teeth 11, 21. Molar relation neutrocclusion. What is the diagnosis in this case?

A 17-year-old woman came RSGM complaining of crowding of her teeth. Extra-oral examination presented normal profile. Intraoral examination revealed that the mesiobuccal cusp of the maxillary first molar was located in the buccal fissure of the mandible and the incisal canines were located in the interdental canines and mandibular first premolars. Crowded teeth appeared in the anterior region of the upper and lower jaws, overjet and overbite are normal. What is the diagnosis for this case?

A 20-year-old woman came to RSGM with complaints of protruding teeth. Extraoral examination presented a convex profile. Intra-oral examination revealed that in centric occlusion, the mesiobuccal cusp of the maxillary first molar was located in the interdental area of the first molar and the mandibular second premolar and the incisal canines were located mesial to the mandibular canine. From the model analysis, it is known that the space discrepancy is -2 mm in the upper and lower jaws, the overjet is 6 mm and the overbite is 2 mm. Permanent teeth are complete. What is the diagnosis for this case?

A 20-year-old woman came to an orthodontic clinic with complaints that she often bites her cheek while chewing. Extraoral examination presented straight profile. Intraoral examination showed that in centric occlusion the relation of mandibular molar cusp were more buccal than the maxillary molars. The maxillary incisors are located in the interdental canines and mandibular first premolars. This condition occurs on both sides. What is the diagnosis for this case?

An 18-year-old female patient comes to the orthodontic clinic with complaints of protruding teeth. Extraoral examination presented a convex profile. Intraoral examination revealed that in centric occlusion, the mesiobuccal cusp of the maxillary first molar was located in the buccal fissure of the mandible and the incisal canines were located in the interdental canines and mandibular first premolars. Cephalometric analysis showed SNA = 86, SNB = 80. What is the diagnosis for this case?

A 20-year-old woman comes to the orthodontic clinic complaining of a prominent chin. Extraoral examination presented a concave profile. Intraoral examination showed that in centric occlusion the mesiobuccal cusp of the maxillary first molar was located in the interdental area of ??the mandibular first and second molars, and the incisal canines were located distal to the mandibular first premolar. Analysis of the model space discrepancy -2 mm on the upper and lower jaw, -2 mm overjet and 2 mm overbite. Cephalometric analysis showed SNA = 80, SNB = 83. What is the diagnosis for this case?

A 20-year-old woman came to an orthodontic clinic with a complaint that her front teeth looked strange. Intra-oral examination showed teeth 13 and 12 erupted in a swap position. What are the types of tooth position abnormalities?

A 17-year-old woman came to the orthodontic clinic complaining of inability to bite in the front teeth. Intra-oral examination revealed that the anterior teeth were not in occlusion. The maxillary anterior teeth were far from the occlusal plane. What is the type of abnormal position of the tooth group?

A 17 year old woman came to the orthodontic clinic complaining of being unable to bite in the front teeth. Intraoral examination revealed that the anterior teeth were not in occlusion. The maxillary anterior teeth were far from the occlusal plane. What is the direction of the bite abnormality of the group of teeth?

An 18 year old woman came to an orthodontic clinic complaining of not being able to chew food properly. Intraoral examination revealed that the palatal cusps of the maxillary posterior teeth were located on the buccal side of the lower posterior teeth. What are the types of bite disorders of this group of teeth?

A 15 year old woman came to an orthodontic clinic complaining of not being able to chew food properly. Intra oral examination revealed that the palatal cusps of the maxillary posterior teeth were located on the buccal side of the lower posterior teeth. What is the direction of the bite abnormality of the group of teeth?

A 13 year old girl came with her mother to the orthodontic clinic of RSGM with complaints of prominent facial features and crowding of teeth. Extraoral examination presented convex profile and symmetrical face. Intraoral examination showed large overjet, teeth 12 and 22 palatoversion and crowding of lower anterior teeth. The relation of the first molar is distocclusion. Which data in the scenario above is categorized as a subjective examination?

A 17-year-old girl came to the RSGM Orthodontic clinic with complaints of prominent facial features and crowding of teeth. Extraoral examination presented convex profile. Large intra oral overjet, teeth 12 and 22 palatoversion and crowding of lower anterior teeth. The first molar relation is distocclusion. Cephalometric analysis of SNA 87O and SNB 82o. What is the interpretation of the cephalometric analysis in the above case?

A 20-year-old man came to the RSGM Orthodontic clinic with complaints of his protruding teeth. Extraoral examination presented convex profile and symmetrical face. Dentists need facial profile data for consideration in determining orthodontic treatment plans. What is the purpose of the examination carried out in this case

answer.text: To evaluate the position of the teeth and jaws of the patient.
To evaluate the position of the mandible relative to the maxilla of the patient
To evaluate the proportion of the face in the vertical direction of the patient.
To evaluate the facial proportions in the transverse direction of the patient
To evaluate the proportions of the face in the horizontal direction of the patient.

questiontext.text: An 11-year-old girl accompanied by her mother came to the orthodontic clinic of RSGM with complaints of crowding of the upper and lower teeth. Extraoral examination presenter normal profile. Intraoral examination of the position of teeth 12 and 22 distopalatal centric rotation and crowding of lower anterior teeth. What is the psychosocial impact of the above case?

answer.text: Barriers to physical development and talent of a child
Developmental barriers to relationships with other people
Barriers to a child's emotional and cognitive development
Barriers to the development of the norms of a child's life
Barriers to mental development and behavior of a child

questiontext.text: A 21-year-old woman came to the orthodontic clinic of the RSGM with complaints of misaligned front teeth. Extraoral examination of a concave profile. Intraoral examination of maxillary incisor crossbite with crowding of mandibular anterior teeth. Dentists need facial profile data for consideration in determining treatment plans. What are the reference points for facial profile assessment in the above case?

answer.text: Glabela, the upper lip contour and pogonion
Glabela, the contour of the upper lip and the contour of the lower lip

questiontext.text: A 9-year-old girl came with her mother to the orthodontic clinic of RSGM with complaints of crowding of her upper front teeth. Extraoral examination presented normal profile. Intraoral examination of teeth 13 and 23 ectostems. Dentist requires facial proportion data for consideration in determining treatment plan. Which of the following data is used to determine the assessment above?

answer.text: Distance trichion - glabela = glabela - subnation = subnation - gnation
Distance trichion - glabela = glabela - subnation = subnation - pogonion
Distance trichion - glabela = glabela - upper lip contour = pogonion
Distance trichion - glabela = glabela - lower lip contour = pogonion
Distance trichion - glabela = glabela - nasal tip = gnation

questiontext.text: A 10-year-old girl came with her mother to the orthodontic clinic of RSGM with complaints of crowding of her upper front teeth. Extraoral examination presented normal profile. Intraoral examination showed teeth 12 and 22 palatoversion. Dentists need data on examination of the patient's facial type for consideration in determining treatment.

answer.text: Measure the distance between the nasion - mention and the distance bizygoma
Measure the distance between trichion - subnasal and bizygoma . distance
Measure the distance between the nasion - the contour of the upper lip and the distance from the bixygoma
Measure the distance between the nasion - lower lip contour and byzygoma distance
Measure the distance between the trichion - upper lip contour and byzygoma distance
